Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, it was discovered the operation failed to report the runaway to the parent entity within the two-hour time frame.
Correction Narrative: On 10/1/25, the administrator provided corrections via email.  Initial corrections were submitted on 9/21/25, but the corrections were not detailed enough.  Administrator held meeting on 9/23/25 with administrative team to discuss the requirements of this standard.  Documented on the weekly admin agenda in the Meeting Agenda Log with the sign in sheet. All administration was present for the meeting, including case managers who are primarily responsible for communication with the children's guardians.

Deficiency Narrative: A contract worker participated in the escalation of a verbal altercation with children in care leading to a child being triggered and injured.
Correction Narrative:
The contract worker was immediately removed from the schedule pending investigation. All contract staff will be screened and monitored to ensure professional conduct consistent with licensing standards and the safety of youth in care.

On 9/9/25 and 9/10/2025 several residences were interviewed and raised no additional concerns for staff or contract workers escalating or becoming involved in altercations with residents.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver did not get CPR/first aid training within the proper timeframe.
Correction Narrative: During the inspection of the operation, the inspector was informed that all staff hired for the operation would undergo first aid/CPR training upon joining. An updated First Aid/CPR training was provided for the staff.

Deficiency Narrative: There operation had expired over the counter medication, medication for a child whom has been discharge and current children stored in the same box.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided a corrective plan which consist of the lead caregiver conducting an audit of medication at the begging of shift and end of shift. The operation will have a supervisory staff conduct medication audit each Monday. The audits are designed to catch any expired medication, inactive medication or medication of a discharge residents' medication still being stored with current medication. The operation has also developed a form to keep tracks of audits.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation did not have medication logs for five prescription medication.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided a corrective plan which consist of the lead caregiver conducting an audit of medication and medication logs at the begging of shift and end of shift. The operation will have a supervisory staff conduct medication log audit each Monday to ensure prescription and over the counter medication are be documented and current logs are in the records.

Deficiency Narrative: Licensing arrived at the facility at 10:30A to conduct an unannounced inspection. After a 2-hour waiting period there was access to active records.
Correction Narrative: Licensing arrived at the facility at 10:30A to conduct an unannounced inspection. After a 2-hour waiting period there was access to active records.

Deficiency Narrative: 3 out of 4 files child files reviewed were incomplete.  72-hour service plans, initial service plans, and a signed copy of the child rights was not in the file.
Correction Narrative: 3 out of 4 files child files reviewed were incomplete.  72-hour service plans, initial service plans, and a signed copy of the child rights was not in the file.

Deficiency Narrative: A resident in care was able to ingest objects on multiple occasions. A safety plan was put into place after multiple self harming incidents occurred, resulting in repeated hospitalizations and surgery.
Correction Narrative: A resident in care was able to ingest objects on multiple occasions. A safety plan was put into place after multiple self harming incidents occurred, resulting in repeated hospitalizations and surgery.

Deficiency Narrative: The operations physical address, and telephone number were missing from a serious incident report that was submitted.
Correction Narrative: Inspection ID 4060305 reflects an inspection was conducted at the operation on 6/9/2025. The operation shows that they have updated their incident report to reflect the missing information. The operation has implemented the usage of updated form.

Deficiency Narrative: A physical altercation between 2 children in care occurred and a staff member was unable to intervene as she was the only staff member on duty.
Correction Narrative:
Guardian Angels will make every effort to ensure there is a shift supervisor and/or lead staff member present during the awake and evening shifts.

During an inspection at the facility, two children in care and one staff member were interviewed regarding supervision. Additionally, during the inspection, there were no concerns about supervision. Three caregivers were on duty, supervising seven children in care. There were no concerns.

Deficiency Narrative: Only 3 serious incident reports out of 8 children who went on an unauthorized leave of absence on two different days were provided to licensing.
Correction Narrative: Inspection ID 4060305 reflects an inspection was conducted at the operation on 6/9/2025. The operation shows that they will have a full review of all incident logs and ensure that any missing documentation related to unauthorized absences, or any other incidents is submitted promptly and accurately. The operation will implement a new tracking system to cross-reference incident logs with submitted reports to ensure none are missed going forward. Administrator will conduct monthly internal audits of incident documentation and provide corrective feedback to responsible supervisors when reports are incomplete or delayed.

Deficiency Narrative: During an inspection, it was observed that two staff members were not practicing self-control, as a child was exhibiting escalating behaviors.
Correction Narrative:
The correction action letter was received with the following corrections: 

1. Ms. Edwards, Director of Residential Services will ensure the two employees involved will receive an NCI Refresher 

2. Ms. Falaki, Compliance Officer, will monitor incident reports and supervisory observations for signs of staff noncompliance and report patterns or concerns to leadership.

3. Ms. McGlory will support training by incorporating coaching on TBRI Principles into bi-weekly team meetings.

Deficiency Narrative: An unauthorized staff gave a child the wrong medication.
Correction Narrative: An unauthorized staff gave a child the wrong medication.

Deficiency Narrative: A child was given another child in care's medication.
Correction Narrative: A child was given another child in care's medication.

Deficiency Narrative: Staff were observed sleeping by children in care.
Correction Narrative: Staff were observed sleeping by children in care.

Deficiency Narrative: Suicide screenings were not immediately administered on a child who attempted to self-harm on three occasions by swallowing inanimate objects.
Correction Narrative: Suicide screenings were not immediately administered on a child who attempted to self-harm on three occasions by swallowing inanimate objects.

Deficiency Narrative: A suicide attempt that occurred on 04/01/25 was not reported until 04/03/25. Suicide attempts that occurred on 04/21/25 and 05/05/25 were not reported to Licensing.
Correction Narrative: As inspection was completed at the operation on 6/6/2025. Interviews with caregivers were conducted and caregivers were told they were informed of all reportable incidents including suicide attempts. Caregivers were also explained the difference between an attempt and ideation. The operation has reported that the operation will be reviewing the incident log weekly to ensure no reportable incidents are missed.

Deficiency Narrative: 4 triggered reviews did not contain all required documentation. This includes a review of the previous unauthorized absences and previous debriefings required in 748.461(1) and level of supervision as required in 748.461(2).
Correction Narrative: An email was received by the operation on 5.7.25. The following was explained- To address the deficiency cited under 748.461(1), the Compliance Officer and Case Manager, under the direction of the Administrator, will ensure that all triggered reviews following unauthorized absences include documentation of the childs previous unauthorized absences, previous debriefings, and a review of the childs level of supervision as required. Moving forward, this information will be consistently reviewed and documented to ensure compliance with licensing standards.

Deficiency Narrative: 3 serious incident reports did not contain all required documentation regarding an elopement. This includes the time and date law enforcement, and parents were notified, along with the names of those notified.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation on 5.7.25. The following was explained- To address the deficiency cited under 748.313(3)(B), the Assistant Administrator and Behavior Support Specialist, under the direction of the Administrator, will ensure all serious incident reports involving elopement include the date and time law enforcement and parents are notified, as well as the names of those contacted. Moving forward, this information will be verified before incident reports are finalized to ensure full compliance with licensing requirements.

Deficiency Narrative: Children in care were able to run away from the facility while being supervised by staff.
Correction Narrative: Inspection ID 4060305. An inspection was conducted at the operation on 6/6/2025. The caregivers reported the children are mostly supervised in the common areas and their bedroom doors are kept locked. Resident must asked staff to unlock the doors. The operation has reviewed expectations with staff to ensure more strategic staff placement during high-risk transitions, monthly incident trend reviews will be conducted to identify and correct supervision gaps, and address any other trends found. In case of an unauthorized absences the operation will updated supervision levels and individualized safety plans for the child involved.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff member failed to follow policy and procedures. The staff member admitted to not conducting checks every 20 minutes as per policy.
Correction Narrative:
1. Assistant Administrator will reinforce the importance of policy adherence through mandatory refresher training for all direct care staff on supervision protocols and documentation procedures.

2. Compliance Officer will implement random audits of supervision logs to ensure 15-minute checks are being completed and documented as required.

3. Assistant Administrator incorporate policy reviews into staff supervisions and ensure all new hires are oriented thoroughly on supervision expectations during onboarding.

Deficiency Narrative: During the monitoring inspection, the recreational chart provided did not contain a of indoor and outdoor recreational activities for the children daily.
Correction Narrative: 1.	Moving forward, the Assistant Administrator and Behavior Support Specialist will ensure the recreation schedule includes indoor and outdoor activities, as well as ensure the schedule is being adhered to. The recreation calendar has been updated.

Deficiency Narrative: The initial service plan for a child in care does not have the signatures or dates of participation for a professional level service provider or managing conservator. Therefore, it is unknown if they participated in the initial service plan meeting or reviewed the initial service plan.
Correction Narrative: The operation submitted the following written correction: Treatment Director and or Professional Service Level Provider will ensure they capture all attending parties' signatures for ISPs to ensure compliance with state minimum standards moving forward.

Deficiency Narrative: Multiple children interviewed confirmed a member of staff made an inappropriate comment to a child in care.
Correction Narrative: Children and administrative staff unanimously stated there has been no reports of insults since last visit.

Deficiency Narrative: Multiple children and staff interviewed confirmed an inappropriate was made to a child by staff.
Correction Narrative: Children and administrative staff unanimously stated there has been no reports of insults since last visit.

Deficiency Narrative: Serious incident reports were reviewed and they did not contain the required minimal standard criteria. The serious incident reports did not discuss the interventions made after the child returned to the facility.
Correction Narrative: Operation has updated the serious incident reports in extended reach system to include interventions made after a child returns to an operation. INSP ID: 4040976

Deficiency Narrative: During the team inspection, complete children's files, and the EBI annual evaluation were not available for review.
Correction Narrative: The complete child record will be available for licensing to review on our Extended Reach system. A username has been created for this purpose. There will also be an individual resident binder available for review. The annual EBI evaluation was completed and observed.

Deficiency Narrative: During the incident / physical altercation, a staff member was heard to be cursing.
Correction Narrative:
Guardian Angels has implemented a corrective action plan that includes enhanced staff training in de-escalation techniques, conflict resolution, and maintaining self-control during resident interactions. This training was conducted during the staff meeting held on December 13, 2024. Additionally, all caregivers are required to complete mandatory refresher courses on appropriate behavior, effective communication, and managing confrontational situations, with a particular focus on Trust-Based Relational Intervention (TBRI) principles. These refresher courses were also conducted.

Following an internal investigation into the incident, the staff member involved was immediately placed on suspension and will remain so until the case is resolved, or further directives are provided by the state.

During the follow up (INSP ID: 4038025) conducted interviews were held with staff and children who reported that there is no cursing on behalf of the staff towards children or in the presence of children, in addition staff reported being trained on TBRI methods. The individual involved in this investigation is no longer employed at the operation.

Deficiency Narrative: Children's clothing are still being taken away as a form discipline.
Correction Narrative: Interviews with children were conducted and their clothing are no longer being removed as a form of discipline.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care had a high-risk behavior of suicidal ideation and was able to grab multiple objects and self-harm.
Correction Narrative: Received a corrective action plan from the facilities case manager stating that the facility will now ensure that the resident involved in this investigation will only be able to use markers and crayons for their art, no compasses or pens.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver became belligerent, yelled, and used profanity in reference to and at a child in care.
Correction Narrative: Refresher training was completed by all staff and a staff meeting took place to remind all staff of the expectations and prohibited punishment methods. In addition, the staff involved in inappropriate discipline methods was terminated.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff member became both verbally and physically aggressive with a child in care. A staff member with protective capacity physically positioned herself between the staff and child in care in an attempt to protect the child.
Correction Narrative: Refresher training was completed by all staff and a staff meeting took place to remind all staff of the expectations and prohibited punishment methods. In addition, the staff involved in inappropriate discipline methods was terminated.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver physically pushed and used a close fist to punch a child in care.
Correction Narrative: Refresher training was completed by all staff and a staff meeting took place to remind all staff of the expectations and prohibited punishment methods. In addition, the staff involved in inappropriate discipline methods was terminated.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, a caregiver failed to maintain self-control when they positioned themselves for a physical confrontation with a child, and verbally provoked the child.
Correction Narrative: A TBRI method of switching out with another staff if they are overwhelmed has been reiterated that it is an available method to use while staff regain composure to maintain self-control. In addition the staff involved in innapropriate discipline methods was terminated.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, it was found that a child was cursed at by a caregiver during a confrontation.
Correction Narrative: Refresher training was completed by all staff and a staff meeting took place to remind all staff of the expectations and prohibited punishment methods. In addition, the staff involved in inappropriate discipline methods was terminated.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, there were multiple accounts of a caregiver pushing a child in care.
Correction Narrative: Refresher training was completed by all staff and a staff meeting took place to remind all staff of the expectations and prohibited punishment methods. In addition, the staff involved in inappropriate discipline methods was terminated.

Deficiency Narrative: The incident report does not contain the required elements for reporting non serious medical incidents as required. The document does not have the physical address or phone number of the operation.
Correction Narrative: The incident documentation was updated in their extended reach system to add the elements that were missing, such as the gender, age, and date of admission. In addition, staff will be trained on incident reports on September 6, 2024, during the all-staff meeting.

Deficiency Narrative: Three children left the operation on 05/30 in the 4pm hour and the unauthorized absence was not reported until 05/31 in the 8am hour.
Correction Narrative: Guardian Angels will report unauthorized absences, as soon as possible but within the 6-hour timeframe; without delay.

Deficiency Narrative: Child in care went on AWOL on 5-16-24 immediately after child got down from the school bus at about 3:25pm and did not return until the next day. Operation staff stated that AWOL report was made on 5-16-24 around 11:50pm which is more than 6 hours report timeframe.
Correction Narrative: The operation sent its correction via email. In its correction, the operation stated that Guardian Angels will report unauthorized absences, as soon as possible but within the 6-hour timeframe; without delay.

Deficiency Narrative: Staff is using an oven to heat the home on multiple occasions.
Two children and one agency staff witnessed an agency staff member sleeping.
Correction Narrative:
HM inspector received an e-mail for compliance. The operation staff member that was sleeping is no longer at the operation. The operation also sent in a response for future compliance: 
Enhanced Monitoring Procedures: We will conduct sporadic walkthroughs by team leads during all shifts to ensure adherence to supervision protocols.
Staff Training: All staff members will undergo a virtual refresher training emphasizing the importance of constant vigilance and the critical nature of their supervisory role.
Accountability Systems: We will introduce accountability systems, including regular performance reviews and incident reporting mechanisms, to promptly address any deviations from expected standards.
Support for Staff Well-being: Recognizing the challenges of caregiver roles, we are enhancing support for staff well-being, including reducing scheduled days and access to wellness resources to help manage stress and prevent fatigue by talking with our Clinical Director when necessary.

Deficiency Narrative: During a review of external documentation, the operation did not complete a suicide screening, as well as a safety plan at the time of admission.
Correction Narrative:
I,RCCL Inspector Michonne Chandler received an email from Guardians Angels case manager stating the following:

Case manager will revise intake packet with a checklist to identify those needs instead of leaving for the caseworker to identify them. 
Case manager has been retrained on completing the Intake Suicide Assessment at Intake, while caseworker is present.     
Case manager will make the safety plan for each intake available to staff and retrain the staff on what to expect with the childs behavior.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation does not have a Treatment Director to oversee the treatment program that provides treatment services for children with emotional disorders.
Correction Narrative:
01/31/2024-The operation's HR Generalist/Compliance Officer submitted via email licensing staff the Corrective Action Plan consisting of the operation's new Clinical Director's Employment Job Offer including start date of February 1, 2024, employment of full-time, expected work dates Monday through Friday signed by Clinical Director as well as additional attachment of the Clinical Director's signed Employee Acceptance letter.

In addition, the operation's HR Generalist/Compliance Officer submitted via email to licensing staff the Clinical's Director's required minimum qualifications including Master's Degree in Clinical Social Work, Psychology, Counseling, or related field, valid Texas license as Licensed Professional Counselor as well as three to five years of program management initialed by the new Clinical Director.

02/02/2024-The operation's HR Generalist/Compliance Officer submitted via email licensing staff the operation's new Clinical Director's license for Licensed Professional Counselor in the state of Texas with effective date of 12/29/2021 as well as expiration date of 05/31/2025.  In addition, the operation's HR Generalist/Compliance Officer submitted via email licensing staff the operation's new Clinical Director's transcript from Prairie View A&M University indicating a Masters in Counseling granted in May 2018.  Additional supporting documents based on the operation's new Clinical Director's resume indicates work experience as an Executive Director/LPC (therapeutic services), Care Coordinator/QMHP (targeted case management), CPS Supervised Visitation Coordinator as well completion of counseling practicum. 

Based on the documents submitted, the operation's new Clinical Director meets qualifications and/or criteria as required by Minimum Standards including education level as well as extensive professional experience.

Deficiency Narrative: Prudent judgment was not applied to a situation where a staff member immediately noticed a change and did not verify the information before preforming assigned tasks.
Correction Narrative: The follow up was completed by inspection (Insp. ID: 4013453) in which medication was observed to be double locked. There is a cabinet in the kitchen that is locked and the medication box itself is also locked. Interviews conducted with children and staff were conducted in which the children are aware of what they are taking, and the staff is also familiar with medication administration procedures.

Deficiency Narrative: Medication was not accurately accounted for medication logs for children in care.
Correction Narrative: The follow up was completed by inspection (Insp. ID: 4013453) in which medication was evaluated and a medication count was conducted and was found to be in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: Scheduled II medication was improperly stored in a kitchen drawer that is not double locked.
Correction Narrative: The follow up was completed by inspection (Insp. ID: 4013453) in which medication was observed to be double locked. There is a cabinet in the kitchen that is locked and the medication box itself is also locked.

Deficiency Narrative: During a review of external documentation, the operation did not complete a suicide screening, as well as a safety plan at the time of admission.
Correction Narrative:
I,RCCL Inspector Michonne Chandler received an email from Guardians Angels case manager stating the following:

Case manager will revise intake packet with a checklist to identify those needs instead of leaving for the caseworker to identify them. 
Case manager has been retrained on completing the Intake Suicide Assessment at Intake, while caseworker is present.     
Case manager will make the safety plan for each intake available to staff and retrain the staff on what to expect with the childs behavior.

Deficiency Narrative: Caregiver conducted restraint on a youth utilizing unapproved technique.
Correction Narrative: In person follow-up conducted.  Youth in care and staff were interviewed.

Deficiency Narrative: Two youth beds were observed to not have a mattress cover during a walkthrough of the operation.
Caregivers at the operation are not physically intervening when children are engaging in a physical altercation.
Correction Narrative: The staff were retrained and discussed supervision and intervening in emergency situations. INSP ID: 4040976

Deficiency Narrative: During a review of the investigation it was determined that a staff member threatened a child in care was threatened with corporal punishment verbally and with hand gestures.
Correction Narrative: Interview with victim confirmed no further incidents. Interview with Ms. McGlory confirmed Mr. Matthews no longer employed at operation. Review of corrective actions following investigation supports the operation increasing its initial new staff training to include the sharing of children's high-risk behaviors and ensuring staff are better trained to meet individual child needs.

Deficiency Narrative: Staff used unnecessary force when pushing a child before restraining her three separate times.
Correction Narrative:
8/17/23: A physical follow-up was conducted at the operation. 3 of the 6 current residents were interviewed, none voiced any concern regarding restraints. - MSLewis 
8/4/23: NCI/CPI Training is a requirement upon hire for our facility. Employees are trained within the first 90 days of employment and are trained by our Certified Instructors here on campus. Our certified instructors conduct refresher trainings every month. Our last one was July 31st.  On August 22nd, we will conduct a refresher on proper implementation of relocating to a safe place, and also proper holds, ie.  Low-Level, Medium Level, and High Level Holding during a crisis or during aggressive behaviors. Our goal with our caregivers is to always use our controlled dynamics of managing the arms, managing the incline, and manage mobility when using interventions to get to residents therapeutic stage.

Deficiency Narrative: Three children in care expressed that a DCS used inappropriate language when talking to them.
Correction Narrative:
8/17/23: A physical follow-up was conducted at the operation. 3 of the 6 current residents were interviewed, none voiced any concern regarding staff using profane language. - MSLewis 
8/4/23: Staff have been trained that profanity and other inappropriate language is not permitted at work and children should not be addressed using appropriate language. Staff will model appropriate language to residents, so that the resident can learn how to carry on conversations with appropriate language. 

This topic will also be retrained during trainings on Cultural Competence and Abuse, Neglect and Exploitation on September 29th and November 3rd, respectively.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff member got into a verbal argument with a resident.
Correction Narrative:
Guardian Angels (GA) sets policies and procedures for resident rights in areas including but not limited to: normal life, discipline, medical care, complaints, parent and sibling contact, privacy and search. 

Discipline, including:
The right to be free from any harsh, cruel, unusual, unnecessary, demeaning, or humiliating treatment or punishment. The means the resident must not be: 
Talked to disrespectfully, use of profane language (towards them and/or in front of them), slapped, shaken, hit, made to run laps, do sit-ups or push-ups, hold an unnatural position or do unproductive work. The use of mechanical and personal restraints and seclusions also are prohibited methods of discipline.
Moving forward, Staff will use strategies taught during and after training:

Strategies and Techniques Staff Can Use to Avoid Abusive/Harmful Behavior:
During orientation to the facility, Staff are taught strategies and techniques they can use to avoid Abusive/harmful behaviors; they are taught to:

	Be sensitive to the resident(s) feelings and recognize words and actions they are using that indicate a rise in frustration or anger.
	When these feelings arise, they must remove themselves from their assigned group by asking permission to go outside or someplace where they can calm down;
	Ask to talk to a supervisor and/or another staff member about their feelings;
	Ask to talk to Human Resources, Executive Director, and/or the Compliance Officer:
	Use all taught techniques that de-escalates any rising or heighten situations that caused these feelings to arise, and how they might avoid the situation in the future and/or positive actions they can take to the situations.
	Be sensitive to the resident(s) feelings and use words that are appropriate for the setting (work) to avert further crisis.
	Practice verbal techniques.
	Avoid name calling and any forms of disrespect

Moving Forward, after each incident has been managed;

Staff will ensure children report all altercations (physical and/or verbal) to an adult (be a direct care staff, Case-manager, LCCA, etc.), while refraining from any form of abuse without retaliation or defense.

Staff may be removed from work schedule pending results from investigation and/or allowed to work in another Unit, while working under a safety plan.

Correction Narrative:

Deficiency Narrative: Four children's service plans were not updated at review to include therapy/skills training frequency, education changes, and/or medication changes.
Correction Narrative:
8/18/22: At the investigation inspection Addendums to all deficient services plans were received, created 8/15/22. 
10/11/22: Per the Administrator, Guardian Angels Case manager and the treatment team will be responsible for making sure that the service plans contain the most accurate and up to date information. The therapists have been notified about the therapy sessions requirements, skills training and will document when sessions are not held and the reason why. Any changes in the resident (s) education will, also, be documented in the service plan by the case manager and checked for accuracy by treatment team. Caseworkers will be notified of the medication their resident may receive within 24 hours of seeing the Psychiatrist.

Deficiency Narrative: According to the Incident Report, a child was restrained in the supine position for 3-10 minutes.
Correction Narrative: Staff will respond to the risk behavior using verbal, nonverbal, and physical approaches appropriate to the person, situation, and level of risk, communicate effectively to relief staff that the resident is indeed in crisis, ensuring that the staff is close enough to provide protection and intervene when necessary to ensure the residents safety, and move for safety when a resident throws an object towards the target (HER) that could possibly cause bodily harm, and ask for assistance (EBI and releasing the resident every 1-2 minutes).

Deficiency Narrative: Four of four reviewed Supervision sections of the children's Service Plans all have the same Supervision needs and goals.
Correction Narrative: Per the Administrator, Guardian Angels will ensure that no two residents have the same identical Supervision Plan. We do understand that even though some have similar behaviors, they are still individuals who react differently, as well as respond to treatment differently. Therefore, they should be Supervised differently.

Deficiency Narrative: A log for Unauthorized Absences has not been created by the operation.
Correction Narrative: An Absent Without Leave Form was created by the operation to include the appropriate information listed in standard.

Deficiency Narrative: Two children engaged in two separate physical altercations in a very short period of time. After the first altercation; there was no attempts remove the children from close proximity.
Correction Narrative:
Per the Administrator, it is Policy that all direct care staff be trained in the prevention of workplace violence (CPI), by a Certified CPI Instructor. Child care staff qualified in behavior intervention must:
Have completed CPI training (initially 16 hours)
Have had reviews with questions/answers section by the LCCA of intervention and de-escalation techniques to be used at the GA:
Monthly demonstrate to the LCCA that he/she remember CPI approved emergency holds: and
Have certified re-fresher training in CPI every 183 days (refresher is 8 hours)

Deficiency Narrative: The preponderance of information gathered determine that profane language is being used at the agency in front of children.
Correction Narrative:
Per the Administrator: 
Staff will be sensitive to the resident(s) feelings and use words that are appropriate for the setting (work) to avert further crisis.
Practice verbal techniques.
A physical follow up was conducted on 5/3/21. No children reported hearing staff use inappropriate language.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff member failed to use prudent judgement or maintain self-control when she allowed children in care to access her cell phone.
Correction Narrative: Guardian Angels has a NO CELL PHONE policy for ALL DIRECT CARE STAFF: due to working in an environment that consists of very strict confidentiality laws. At no time during the shift, should any Direct Care Staff member use (text, call, email, social media, photos, etc.) their cell phone, unless given express permission from a Supervisor.
